name: BEST WESTERN Bologna Hotel - Mestre Station

reviews.title: Friendly, comfortable, convenient
reviews.text: If you are staying in Maestre, just outside of Venice, this hotel is most convenient. Do not be afraid to see Venice this way. The staff is 5 star. Maestre is not to write home about but we did take a walk around the area during our 5 day stay. There are few good restaurants. Save your dining magic for Venice or the hotel restaurant which is pretty good. H Bologna is across the street from the train stn & it is a nice area. There is cheap internet down the street af few blocks at a market (take a right out of the hotel and another right around the hotel-do during the day). The bus stops right outside too. It is easy to get to Venice. The room was large like the pix, and the bathrooms were ultra luxury compared to island hotels. The happy hour is wonderful (cheeses, snacks) and Moreno pours a generous glass. The manager is very professional and fantastic and even bought us a drink because we praised his hotel. Breakfast is one of the best in a bright bustling room. A BIG PLUS is you can park your car here and they charged us 10E a day if I recall, but that was over a year ago. This is available even if you are not staying at the hotel. My son said that he parked at a hotel (2006) across the street (I think) and stayed in Venice and it cost him less. This is a real parking find and it is safe/guarded. The train runs often, as do the buses. #1 & #5 if I recall correctly. Leaving just out of the station and arriving right outside the door. It is quiet, clean, elevator, internet (not cheap), and plenty of room everywhere. My husband & I will stay here again.

This is a convenient location for both Venice Treviso airport and central Venice, without paying central Venice prices. Mestre is a few minutes on a train to the centre of Venice. The bus from Vence Treviso (Ryanair) airport stops right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: if visint Venice stay here

likes.liked: — the fact that the station is the other side of the street
likes.disliked: — the breakfast was a bit basic but it seems to be across all of Italy

reviews.text: We were impressed with this hotel, the staff were very helpful, the train in to Venice I think costs 1euro each way, maybe 2 can't remember - and trains run every few minutes during the day.
reviews.title: Easy access to Venice

likes.liked: — Modern comforts, close to Venice and train station

reviews.title: Great Deal, Excellent Locattion, Delightful Rooms, Excellent Service
reviews.text: We can only say good things about this hotel after our two night stay. I would recommend anyone visiting Venice to stay here, especially if you are flying Ryanair to Treviso airport. Make sure you tell the driver that you are staying in Mestre as our one went straight to Venice without stopping - I think he had some scam going on with the cab drivers but that's gone off the subject.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best Western Bologna is a good place to stay while visiting Venice if you can't find somewhere in the city center. If you want old world Italian charm, don't stay here. If you want modern comforts, I would recommend it. It is rather pricey, but was less than other places we looked at in Venice. We paid 160 Euro for a double room. The rooms are modern and well equipped. They have a large buffet breakfast, which was good. This hotel is literally across the street from Mestre station, which is about a 10 minute train ride into Venice - very convenient. The staff was friendly, especially a man Andrea who recommended a great restaurant called Old Way Pub in English, but something else in Italian. The area around the hotel is nothing to see, but we liked the proximity to the train station and easy access to Venice. Has an elevator and is undergoing refurbishments in the lobby.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel that truly delivers on all aspects of lodging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a perfect location. 10 minutes to Venice on the train, costing 1 Euro. Mestre itself is a nice town, there was a jazz festival on when we were there. The hotel was clean and fairly modern, but all the rooms have laminated wooden floors and you can hear everyone moving around. The hotel is on a busy road and the traffic and dustbin lorries collecting are very noisy. We had to call Reception at 4am due to noise levels on floors above, but staff not very helpful. There is some renovation work being carried out at the moment and the workmen started drilling at 8am! Its a shame as the location is fantastic and the breakfasts are good. (We made up rolls and pastries to take for our lunch!) If you want to see Venice and then escape to somewhere more modern with great clothes and shoe shops, bring earplugs!
reviews.title: Don't expect to get any sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern,very clean hotel in a great and convenient position. Opposite train station with a '1 stop and you're there' train ride across the lagoon, a nice start to your day. If you are staying longer than a few days, you could also catch a train to Treviso or Verona! Excellent breakfast buffet, all you could want really! Our room was slightly small but 'perfectly formed' with everything you would hope for in a 4 star hotel.Lovely,large, contemporary,spotless bathroom. The windows block any noise from the street and our room was quiet. We stayed a week and had reasonably priced bar snacks and amazingly thick, delicious hot chocolate. The barman was extremely pleasant, in fact all the staff were cheerful and helpful, which just added to our holiday. We were really happy with our choice and especially with the price! It was a great find and we would definely go back.
reviews.title: The Clever Choice

likes.liked: — We loved everything! So that is difficult to answer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in April while visiting Venice and Verona, purely on the basis of the good reviews on here! They weren't wrong!
reviews.title: Very Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great, a ten minute train ride into Venice costs just one euro and is a doddle to do. (Tickets can be bought in the hotel).
reviews.title: A great stay
Great Location, Clean and Comfortable
reviews.text: The rooms are small but perfectly adequate, nice and spacious bathroom. Very clean and serviced daily. Staff both on reception and at the bar were friendly and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As previous reviews have stated, this is very well located hotel being opposite the train station which then takes just a 10 minute train ride into Venice for 1 euro each way.
reviews.title: Great Location - shame about the building works!

likes.disliked: — Remedial works so they have closed the stairs!

reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location
reviews.text: The hotel will be good when they have finished the upgrading works but be warned, there is currently only 1 lift which services both wings of the hotel as the stairs are shut off and you can wait some time for the lift to arrive. This was something which worried my husband and I - how would you get out of your room in the event of an evacuation/fire? I don't believe they could get away with this situation from a health & safety perspective in the UK ....

reviews.title: perfect for our needs to be near train and venice
reviews.text: Overall a good experience - food very good, reception staff terribly helpful and a great location. So, with luck, when the remedial works are complete, it will be a great find.

The hotel is very easy to get to, just jump on a bus which takes you from the airport to Mestre FC Railway station (cost 3 Euros each). The hotel is located just outside Venice but it is opposite the railway station which takes you into the centre of Venice every 10 minutes and the journey takes about 5 minutes (you can not hear the trains). Train tickets can be bought from the tabacco shop for 2 Euros return (cheap). The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom is very clean and spacious for a couple (size of a family room). We had a very comfortable double bed and a nice plasma TV. The room is very modern. It was cleaned on a daily basis. Breakfast was included which offered a varitey of food and again staff was very friendly. The Bar was great, you can drink one glass of wine for 1 Euro (67pence), very cheap!!!! We definatley recommend a local restuarant called "Resturant Moro", excellent food and service. It is only a few hundred metres away from hotel. Overall a great hotel and location and would definitely highly recommend it to everyone.
reviews.title: Cramped But Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As everyone states, it is literally right across the street from the train station. Stayed in two rooms with 5 person family. The hotel is clean, the breakfast buffet was great and a good way to start the day. I like the layout of the rooms and IKEA feel to the place. We had some noise outside but it turned out to be the smoking/rest area for the staff to sit. The room key also serves as the AC and light "switch". Be sure to insert it upside down. The bed was comfortable but nothing luxurious. Staff was friendly and handled various tourist type requests with a smile. Downside was only one pc for internet access, the stairs were actually nailed shut due to construction, no tv channels in english (which for some of us was not a problem) ,there is only one lift which is slow. Still, we would stay there again if necessary.
reviews.title: Great choice for venice, but dont upgrade

likes.disliked: — Arrogant restaurant staff who cared little for tourists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was easily the best we stayed in.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were let into our room early. The room was really very modern and specious. All the facilities were modern and comfortable. The bathroom even had speakers in so that you could listen to music or the TV whilst showering! The bed was very comfortable and the air-conditioning was very quiet.
reviews.title: Loved the Breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best things about the hotel was the breakfast! The breakfast had everything, pastries, eggs, fruits, breads and meats, the most varieties of fruit juices I have seen, truly the breakfast was exceptional! The staff seemed friendly and helpful and we found the hotel location excellent opposite the train station and away from the hustle and bustle of Venice. Mestre is only 15 minutes by train or bus to Venice and the journey is lovely across a bridge over the sea. I would definitely stay here again as the hotel was excellent and also Mestre itself has some excellent restaurants including one only streets away from the Hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.text: If you want to see Venice at the same time want to stay away from the hustle and bustle of the tourists. This is a good hotel! It's definitely above average from the American Best Western Hotel. You can take the bus to the hotel from San Marcos Airport, the bus was very cheap. The bus drops you off at the train station, which is a little pass the main terminal. *Be aware though, the hotel is literally right across the street from the main terminal of the station. My husband and I didn't see the hotel and instead went around the block with our "luggages" looking for the hotel. When we found the hotel, we didn't realize it was to the left of the train station from where the bus dropped us off. It was an adventure looking for the hotel and asking strangers that didn't know how to speak English.
reviews.title: really good affordable hotel

reviews.text: Transportation to Venice from the hotel was very convenient because the train station is right across the street! It only takes 5 minutes to get to Venice via the train. You can either purchase your ticket from the station or from the hotel front desk.
reviews.title: Very Modern, clean and great location

likes.liked: — Modern and close to train station
